TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit HttpRequestMessageExtensionMethods extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides extension methods for accessing user principal associated with the HTTP request message.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal GetUserPrincipal (this System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage httpRequestMessage);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal GetUserPrincipal(class System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage httpRequestMessage) cil managed

Docs.param: The HTTP request message from which to get the user principal.
Docs.summary: Gets the user principal associated with the specified HTTP request message.
Docs.returns: The user principal associated with the specified HTTP request message.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetUserPrincipal (this System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage httpRequestMessage, System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal user);
.method public static hidebysig void SetUserPrincipal(class System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage httpRequestMessage, class System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal user) cil managed

Docs.param: The HTTP request message from which to set the user principal.
Docs.summary: Replaces the user principal associated with the specified HTTP request message.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message ToMessage (this System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage httpRequestMessage);
.method public static hidebysig class System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message ToMessage(class System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage httpRequestMessage) cil managed

Docs.param: The from which to create the instance.
Docs.summary: Creates a instance from an instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> instance can be read, written and copied just as a traditional <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ByteStreamMessage> instance. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> instance can also "read" to retrieve the original <xref:System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage> instance by calling the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageExtensionMethods.ToHttpRequestMessage%2A> extension method.
